SEARCH

Class Matrix<N extends Number>

java.lang.Object
Matrix<N>
Type Parameters:
N - The type of Number (e.g., Integer, Float, Double) this matrix will store.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable
public class Matrix<N extends Number> extends Object implements Serializable, Cloneable
Matrix Class representing a two-dimensional array with additional matrix operations. It is designed to perform various operations on matrices commonly used in linear algebra.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

    • Matrix

      public Matrix(int rows, int columns, N Default)
      Constructs a new matrix with the specified number of rows and columns, initializing all elements with a default value.
      Type Parameters:
      N - The type of numbers stored in the matrix. This must extend Number.
      Parameters:
      rows - The number of rows in the new matrix.
      columns - The number of columns in the new matrix.
      Default - The default value to initialize all elements in the matrix.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified rows or columns are zero or negative.

      Constructs a new matrix by copying the elements of the specified matrix.
      Type Parameters:
      N - The type of numbers stored in the matrix. This must extend Number.
      Parameters:
      other - The matrix to be copied.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the specified matrix is null.

      public Matrix<N> setValueAt(int row, int column, N value)
      Sets the value at the specified row and column in the matrix.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index where the value is to be set.
      column - The column index where the value is to be set.
      value - The value to set at the specified position.
      Returns:
      The matrix itself (for method chaining).
      Throws:
      Matrix.MatrixException - If the specified row or column is out of bounds.

    • getValueAt

      public N getValueAt(int row, int column)
      Retrieves the value at the specified row and column in the matrix.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the value to retrieve.
      column - The column index of the value to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The value at the specified position in the matrix.
      Throws:
      Matrix.MatrixException - If the specified row or column is out of bounds.

    • getValueAt

      public N getValueAt(int row, int column, N Default)
      Retrieves the value at the specified row and column in the matrix. If the specified indices are out of bounds, the provided default value is returned.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the value to retrieve.
      column - The column index of the value to retrieve.
      Default - The default value to return if the specified indices are out of bounds.
      Returns:
      The value at the specified position in the matrix, or the default value if out of bounds.

    • addition

      public static <T extends Number> Matrix<T> addition(Matrix<T> m1, Matrix<T> m2)
      Adds two matrices element-wise. Both matrices must have the same dimensions. If the dimensions do not match, an exception is thrown.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of numbers stored in the matrix. This must extend Number.
      Parameters:
      m1 - The first matrix to add.
      m2 - The second matrix to add.
      Returns:
      A new Matrix object containing the element-wise sum of m1 and m2.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the dimensions of the matrices do not match.

    • multiplication

      public static <T extends Number> Matrix<T> multiplication(Matrix<T> m1, Matrix<T> m2)
      Performs matrix multiplication of two matrices m1 and m2. The number of columns in m1 must equal the number of rows in m2.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of numbers stored in the matrix. This must extend Number.
      Parameters:
      m1 - The first matrix to multiply.
      m2 - The second matrix to multiply.
      Returns:
      A new Matrix object that contains the product of m1 and m2.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the number of columns in m1 does not match the number of rows in m2.

    • transposition

      public static <T extends Number> Matrix<T> transposition(Matrix<T> m)
      Computes the transpose of a given matrix. The transpose of a matrix is obtained by swapping its rows and columns.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of numbers stored in the matrix. This must extend Number.
      Parameters:
      m - The matrix to be transposed.
      Returns:
      A new Matrix object that contains the transpose of the input matrix.

    • equal

      public static <T extends Number> boolean equal(Matrix<T> m1, Matrix<T> m2)
      Compares two matrices for equality.
      Parameters:
      m1 - the first matrix to compare
      m2 - the second matrix to compare
      Returns:
      true if the matrices have the same dimensions and all corresponding elements are equal; false otherwise
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if either matrix is null

    • subtraction

      public static <T extends Number> Matrix<T> subtraction(Matrix<T> m1, Matrix<T> m2)
      Subtracts two matrices element-wise and returns the result as a new matrix.

      The method performs element-wise subtraction between the elements of the two matrices m1 and m2. The matrices must have the same dimensions; otherwise, a DimensionsDoNotMatch exception is thrown.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of numbers contained in the matrices, which must extend Number
      Parameters:
      m1 - the first matrix
      m2 - the second matrix
      Returns:
      a new matrix containing the element-wise subtraction of m1 and m2
      Throws:
      Matrix.MatrixException - if the dimensions of the two matrices do not match

    • add

      public Matrix<N> add(Matrix<N> other)
      Adds the current matrix to another matrix and updates the current matrix with the result.
      Type Parameters:
      N - The type of numbers stored in the matrix. This must extend Number.
      Parameters:
      other - The matrix to be added to the current matrix.
      Returns:
      The updated current Matrix instance containing the sum.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the dimensions of the current matrix and the other matrix do not match.

    • add

      public Matrix<N> add(N constant)
      Adds a constant value to each element of the current matrix and updates the current matrix with the result.

      This method performs an element-wise addition, where the specified constant is added to each element of the matrix. The matrix is updated in place with the sum.

      Parameters:
      constant - the constant value to be added to each element of the matrix
      Returns:
      this matrix, updated with the result of the element-wise addition

    • subtract

      public Matrix<N> subtract(Matrix<N> other)
      Subtracts the given matrix from this matrix and updates the current matrix with the result.

      This method performs an element-wise subtraction of the matrix other from the current matrix, where other is subtracted from the current matrix. The dimensions of the two matrices must be the same; otherwise, an exception is thrown.

      Parameters:
      other - the matrix to be subtracted from this matrix
      Returns:
      this matrix, updated with the result of the subtraction
      Throws:
      Matrix.MatrixException - if the dimensions of the two matrices do not match

    • subtract

      public Matrix<N> subtract(N constant)
      Subtracts a constant value from each element of the current matrix and updates the current matrix with the result.

      This method performs an element-wise subtraction, where the specified constant is subtracted from each element of the matrix. The matrix is updated in place with the result of the subtraction.

      Parameters:
      constant - the constant value to be subtracted from each element of the matrix
      Returns:
      this matrix, updated with the result of the element-wise subtraction

    • multiply

      public Matrix<N> multiply(Matrix<N> other)
      Multiplies the current matrix by another matrix and updates the current matrix with the result.
      Type Parameters:
      N - The type of numbers stored in the matrix. This must extend Number.
      Parameters:
      other - The matrix to be multiplied with the current matrix.
      Returns:
      The updated current Matrix instance containing the product.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the number of columns of the current matrix does not match the number of rows of the other matrix.

    • multiply

      public Matrix<N> multiply(N constant)
      Multiplies each element of the current matrix by a constant value and updates the current matrix with the result.

      This method performs an element-wise multiplication where each element of the matrix is multiplied by the provided constant value. The matrix is updated in place with the result.

      Parameters:
      constant - the constant value to multiply each matrix element by
      Returns:
      this matrix, updated with the result of the element-wise multiplication

    • transpose

      public Matrix<N> transpose()
      Computes the transpose of the current matrix and updates it with the result.
      Type Parameters:
      N - The type of numbers stored in the matrix. This must extend Number.
      Returns:
      The updated current Matrix instance containing the transpose.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object other)
      Compares this matrix to the specified object for equality.

      This method checks if the specified object is also a matrix and, if so, compares the contents of both matrices using the equal(Matrix, Matrix) method.

      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      other - the object to compare with this matrix
      Returns:
      true if the other object is a matrix of the same type and has the same values as this matrix; false otherwise

      Prints the matrix to the console.
      Returns:
      The matrix itself (for method chaining).

    • forEach

      public void forEach(Consumer<N> F)
      Applies the provided function to each element in the matrix.
      Parameters:
      F - A consumer function that takes an element of type N and processes it.

    • map

      public <X> X[][] map(Function<N,X> F)
      Applies a given function to each element of the current matrix and returns a new array containing the results.

      This method iterates over each element of the current matrix, applies the provided function F to each element, and constructs a new array of type X. The resulting array will have the same dimensions as the original matrix.

      Type Parameters:
      X - the type of the elements in the resulting array, which can be different from the type of elements in the original matrix
      Parameters:
      F - a function that takes an element of type N (the type of the original matrix elements) and returns an element of type X
      Returns:
      a new array containing the results of applying the function F to each element of the current matrix

    • reduce

      public N reduce(BiFunction<N,N,N> F, N init)
      Performs a reduction on the elements of the matrix using a specified binary operation and an initial value.

      This method iterates through each element of the matrix and applies the provided binary function F to each element and an accumulator (the current value of collector). The operation is performed from left to right, and the result is accumulated in collector. The final value of the accumulator is returned after processing all elements of the matrix.

      Parameters:
      F - a binary function that takes two elements of type N and returns a single element of type N, used for the reduction
      init - the initial value for the reduction operation
      Returns:
      the result of the reduction operation, after applying the function F to all elements of the matrix

    • addRow

      public Matrix<N> addRow(N... elements)
      Adds a new row to the matrix with the specified elements. If the matrix is currently empty (null), this method initializes it with the provided row. Otherwise, it appends the new row to the existing matrix, ensuring that the number of elements matches the current column count.
      Parameters:
      elements - A variable-length argument (varargs) representing the elements of the new row.
      Returns:
      The matrix itself (for method chaining).
      Throws:
      Matrix.MatrixException - If the number of elements does not match the number of columns in the matrix.

    • flatten

      public N[] flatten()
      Flattens the matrix into a one-dimensional array.
      Returns:
      a one-dimensional array containing all the elements of the matrix

      public Matrix<N> clone()
      Overrides:
      clone in class Object
